posts.name: Uma
posts.cooked:
@carlton
Error in github|690x69
I have the users_file in github and I am able to see it . still my verification says 404 error. Kindly help with this
Regards
Uma

posts.name: Pradeep Kumar P
posts.cooked: looks like it is expecting users.csv repositories.csv and readme file and with some contents in both the csv (not an empty file). then it accepts the url, check it out if this helps

posts.name: Uma
posts.cooked:
but the file is there I am able to see the content too . i have attached the screenshot.

usersfile862×842 42.4 KB

repo file1485×912 124 KB

Both the files are there. Kindly help with this issue. And also about the questions I am able to answer from excel file too but the answer says incorrect. Is this happening because of the first url question.
Thanks uma

posts.name: Anand S
posts.cooked: If you look very carefully, @umaskn you’ll find that the file name is not exactly “users.csv” – there’s a subtle difference.

posts.name: Uma
posts.cooked:
Yes sir got it . It is because of the issue in file . my columns got deleted when converting to csv. Now it got resolved . Thank you Sir
Regards
uma

posts.name: Deepesh Gotherwal
posts.cooked:
Hello sir,
I am facing the same issue. My file name is users.csv but it is showing the error as “Error while verifying. Error: users.csv: 404”. Please find the attached images for the same.

image21208×676 30.1 KB

image11152×268 10.4 KB

Sir, please guide me.
Thanks

posts.name: Sid
posts.cooked:
Hi. Did you mention the GitHub repo url in the assignment page? (before Question 1)
https://tools-in-data-science.pages.dev/project1

It should be of the format

https://github.com/[login]/[repository]

posts.name: Deepesh Gotherwal
posts.cooked: I pasted the git repo in mentioned format. It is showing error as mentioned earlier.

posts.name: Deepesh Gotherwal
posts.cooked:
hi, can you tell how did you resolve your issue?
TIA

posts.name: G Shashank Reddy
posts.cooked: Check if the branch is main or not.

posts.name: Uma
posts.cooked:
Ya . In my case initially rows were wrong got only 30 and after that my columns were missing I got only 4. So until your data in the github is correct you will be getting this not found error. When we convert to csv some errors occur. so checkin your colab whether the file has all the columns and rows
Regards
uma

posts.name: Deepesh Gotherwal
posts.cooked: thanks for your reply. I will check it.
